intro: Berula angustifolia subvar. gracile, commonly known as slender waterplantain, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color, and its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and typically have a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It is often found in shallow water or moist soil, and it plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for wetland restoration and ecological studies.
